channel.title: What if I don't have a router?
channel.description: I was reading a tutorial on how to make a server and I've done everything right it's just that when it comes to portforwarding, first when i go to cmd and type in ipconfig it says "ipconfig is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file", and second of all I don't have a router so how do I portforward? And if you could give me the definition of static IP then that would be great! Thanks

item.title: What if I don't have a router?
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:10, topic:267414”][quote author=Si Force link=topic=353069.msg2801419#msg2801419 date=1243457448]
Buy a VPS or a dedicated server as _Ikram has mentioned, it would be the easiest way, although it isn’t free.
[/quote]
To be honest, theres no point buying a dedicated server untill you find your Upload rate, if your upload rate is under 300KB/S, theres no point in buying a dedicated server because it’s still connected to the same internet… Trust me, i no! I was using a friends dedicated server, (cos him £400) And there server could only hold 40 people because of the upload rate.[/quote]

300Kb s[sup]-1[/sup] is fine for any type of server except something like a busy FTP server. The bottleneck is almost always the shitty coding of the server source, not the hardware specifications or connection speed. And if you really have proved the connection speed relates to player capacity, there’s something seriously wrong with how the server and clients communicate and exchange packets.

Read full topic
item.source: What if I don't have a router?

item.title: What if I don't have a router?
item.dc:creator: @Skullator Skullator
item.description:
@Skullator wrote:

You don’t need to port forward with a router.

Read full topic
item.source: What if I don't have a router?

item.title: What if I don't have a router?
item.dc:creator: @The_cook_from_runesc The cook from runescape
item.description:
@The_cook_from_runesc wrote:

A router blocks all incoming connections unless you set otherwise (or set as default). If you connect directly to the internet all ports are accessible externally, but your firewall will be set up in the same way as a router - to only allow certain software to access certain ports.

As people have kind of said, modify your firewall to unblock the ports. Portforwarding is not needed.

Read full topic
item.source: What if I don't have a router?

item.title: What if I don't have a router?
item.dc:creator: @_Mysterio .:Mysterio:.
item.description:
@_Mysterio wrote:

without router ppl can connect right away without portforwarding?

if not, im hosting my server trough utorrent~

utorrent is a bit more work to get it on each time, but it isn’t taht hard

and you can’t see /ipconfig becuase most likely you DELETED the hole sentencice at setting envroiment tables (or however you spell it) the sentencice that was first there is used to do /ipconfig

Read full topic

item.title: What if I don't have a router?
item.dc:creator: @Efilite Efilite
item.description:
@Efilite wrote:

If you don’t have a router you can go to connect to and then right click, go to properties and you can set the port there, alteast that’s what I used to do.
